meanings.definition: Covered with or consisting of scurf.
meanings.sent1: The cat's scurfy fur needed a good brushing.
meanings.sent2: Her scurfy scalp was itchy and uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: The scurfy snow on the ground made it look like powdered sugar.
meanings.sent4: The old book had scurfy pages that crumbled at the touch.
meanings.sent5: The scurfy skin on the apple indicated it was overripe.

meanings.sent1: The scurfy plant leaves shed tiny flakes all over the table.
meanings.sent2: The scurfy tree bark peeled off in patches.
meanings.sent3: The scurfy dog left a trail of flakes wherever it went.
meanings.sent4: The scurfy scalp produced an excess of dandruff.
meanings.sent5: The scurfy blanket shed fibers all over the couch.

meanings.sent1: The pastry had a scurfy texture due to the added oats.
meanings.sent2: The old painting had a scurfy appearance from years of neglect.
meanings.sent3: The scurfy clouds in the sky looked like fluffy cotton balls.
meanings.sent4: The scurfy fabric felt rough against her skin.
meanings.sent5: The scurfy sound of the old record player added to its charm.
